summary: The Defending Education Transparency and Ending Rogue Regimes Engaging in Nefarious Transactions Act (DETERRENT Act) amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to strengthen disclosure requirements for foreign gifts and contracts received by institutions of higher education. It prohibits contracts with entities and countries of concern, mandates institutional policies regarding conflicts of interest arising from foreign engagements, and requires investment disclosure. The bill also establishes enforcement mechanisms, fines for violations, and interagency information sharing to ensure transparency and accountability. It also creates a publicly accessible database and requires institutions to designate a compliance officer. The bill aims to protect national security.
